text:
RAFAEL CASTRO: In 2016,
I had the opportunity

to study in Europe,
specifically Dublin, Ireland.

The experience was incredible
because my goal was always

to work for the
giant tech companies.

When I returned to
Central America,

I noticed that there
was a certain market
for these skills.

So I wanted to start
a consultancy firm,

but, unfortunately, the world
was paralyzed by the pandemic.

It was not only in July
2020 that I saw the light
at the end of the tunnel.

I received a chance to
start as a DevOps engineer.

When the challenge
progressed, I accompanied it

with continuous learning path
to improve my credibility

not only with my great team
but with our customers.

And that's why I chose
Stanford University

to continue my
professional education

and to get some credential
with reputation.

I'm sure that my
knowledge and skills

that this program provided
me are well-received
anywhere in the world.

Maybe here in Latin America,
not only in El Salvador,

we see as unreachable all
this kind of opportunities.

My motivation is to leave
a mark in everything

I do to be an inspiration
for those who, like me, face

limitations to show
them that the goal is
greater than the obstacle.
Get out of your comfort zones.

Do not seek to be employed;
instead, seek to be employable.

There is no better place to
consolidate this knowledge
than in this program.
